name: European Consortium of Anchors Producers
goal:
The consortium is not conceived to make money and intends:
a) To give the associates assistance and protect their legitimate interests, and to operate for the development and progress of the associates’ business, respecting the quality, the safety and the environment;
b) To carry out and promote services and research and advise activities for the improvement and innovation of the products and the processes;
c) To participate actively with studies, tests, research and whatever else will be useful, to the current international process for the preparation of standards, guidelines and any technical document related to standardization and to the CE marking of the associates’ products;
d) To act- within the limits of these articles- for the associated companies in their relations with political, administrative and technical organs, both public and private, in domestic and international sitting, as well as in those Institutions, Bodies, Organizations, domestic and international meetings where the consortium’s presence is required, establishing also more frequent and lasting relations;
e) To carry out general activities and services in favor of the associates, also to promote and support agreements between the associated companies or with other Bodies, in their common interest;
f) To develop communication activities to give a proper image of the consortium and its associates’ business;
g) To carry out all those activities acknowledged by the statute organs as useful to reach the institutional aims.
euInitiatives:
ECAP follow the activities related to the Construction Products Regulation and its implementation:

1) ECAP Secretary General attends on behalf of SBS (Small Business Standards) the following meetings: Standing Committee on Construction, Advisory Group, CPR implementation technical platforms.

2) ECAP Secretary General attends on behalf of CPE (Construction Products Europe) the following meetings: EOTA Technical Board.
ECAP attends bilateral meetings with EOTA and the European Commission on the transfer of ETAGs into EADs.

3) ECAP has been member of the high level tripartite strategic forum of: “Construction 2020”, Groups: “Sustainable use of natural resources" and “Internal Market for Construction Products & Services".
